title: How to Not Be Dry over Text

steps.title: Dry texters often expect the other person to start the conversation.
steps.content: Dry texters often expect the other person to start the conversation . All conversations (including texts!) require an equal amount of give and take. Instead of waiting for the other person to shoot you a text, feel free to get the conversation going on your own. [1] X Research source â€œHappy Sunday! â˜€ Any big plans for the day?â€ â€œJust saw your Snap Story! Looks like you had a great time last night ğŸ˜„â€

You ready for the science test today?â€ â€œOMG you wonâ€™t believe the dog I just passed on my walk today ğŸ˜­â€ â€œMy sister just took me to a cat cafe and it was the cutest thing ever ğŸ¥ºğŸˆ Weâ€™ve got to go together sometime!â€

steps.title: Your IRL convos focus on a specific topic, so make sure your text chats do, too.
steps.content: Your IRL convos focus on a specific topic, so make sure your text chats do, too. steps.title: This proves that you really care about and listen to what they say.
steps.content: This proves that you really care about and listen to what they say. Maybe your texting partner had a big test coming up, or they were stressing about an upcoming vet appointment for their pup. steps.title: Give your texting partner the same time and attention youâ€™d give an IRL friend.
steps.content: Give your texting partner the same time and attention youâ€™d give an IRL friend. Yes, texting is meant to be a quick, on-the-go way of chatting with peopleâ€”but that doesnâ€™t mean your texts should sound super dry and detached. Take all the time you need to really read through the other personâ€™s text, so you can send a thoughtful, engaging reply. steps.title: A quick reply shows youâ€™re interested and invested in the conversation.
steps.content: A quick reply shows youâ€™re interested and invested in the conversation. Letâ€™s be realâ€”texting convos are way more fun when you have a regular back-and-forth. While you donâ€™t have to reply immediately to a message, do your best to reply within a few minutes so you seem really engaged in the convo. I was at the grocery storeâ€ or â€œSo sorry for the late reply. I was just getting caught up on the math homework, LOLâ€

steps.title: GIFs
steps.content: GIFs allow you to be really expressive and fun over text. Not sure how to put your thoughts and feelings into words? Thereâ€™s probably a GIF for that. steps.title: Memes
steps.content: Memes are a great way to earn a few laughs. Although memes can be a little hit or miss sometimes, but theyâ€™re still a great way to add some personality and humor to your usual texts. steps.title: Open-ended questions

They require a little extra thought and consideration to answerâ€”in other words, they canâ€™t be answered with a simple â€œyesâ€ or â€œno.â€ Drop an interesting question in the chat and see where your conversation leads! steps.title: An obviously flirty message will keep your texting partner on their toes.
steps.content: An obviously flirty message will keep your texting partner on their toes. Set a flirty tone by sending a pic of something that reminds you of them, or by subtly hinting that you both should get together sometime. steps.content: This shows that youâ€™re genuinely interested in what they have to say. The only thing worse than a dry text conversation is one-sided one. steps.content: Interesting, engaged texters are able to have balanced conversations. Made yourself a 5-star PB&J for lunch? Drop a pic in the chat. Had the craziest dream last night? Spill all of the chaotic, zany details over text. steps.content: Zany, unpredictable messages will always keep your texting partner guessing. Did you know that Filipino McDonaldâ€™s has spaghetti on the menu, or that strawberries arenâ€™t technically berries? Well, you know now, but your texting partner definitely wonâ€™t! steps.title: The more intrigue you create, the more interesting your texts will be.
steps.content: The more intrigue you create, the more interesting your texts will be. If you present yourself as an open book, your texting partner can start to figure you outâ€”and whereâ€™s the fun in that? Instead, sprinkle tidbits of information into your texts without painting the full picture for them.
